What is it?

Interactive Media concerns all forms of interactivity within virtual environments, whether that be User Experience on websites, software solutions, or game mechanics on consoles. It tackles Human-Computer Interaction at its core, from the research process to the development of interactive technologies themselves.

My Experience

Most of my experience involves User Interface and User Experience design for web applications, though I have some experience with Game Design and Development as well. I aim to continue working on projects, whether for work or for passion, to build upon my interaction design experience for game development in the long-run.

Play around with the console buttons to find out more!

Tools Known

Web Development

Here are some Web Application projects I worked on throughout my time in college.

CS179.2 WEB PROGRAMMING

FINAL OUTPUT: Mock Blog Website

Created a Blog-type website that used JavaScript and AJAX to deliver dummy JSON text from JSONPlaceholder and format it into blog posts.

MIS121 & MIS131 SYSTEM ANALYSIS AND DESIGN

FINAL OUTPUT: Online Shop

ROLE: UI/UX, QA, Systems Analyst

Year-long group project. Partnered with a small business to deliver a software and database solution. Final output was an online shop that recorded and tracked user profiles and purchase requests. The group used Python with Django to create the app.

INTERNSHIP AT PROUDCLOUD

OUTPUT: Adtech - Advertisement REST API

Program which relayed advertisement content from a database onto a screen. Worked on code for the REST API server handling the project.

Game Development

Though my official course is Management Information Systems, I have taken a few Game Development and Object Oriented Programming classes both for my course and my specialization.

CS21 Introduction to Programming

FINAL OUTPUT: Mock "Tinder" Application

Used C# to create a program resembling Tinder. The program handled user registration, logins, and profiles, and simulated "matching" with an array of registered profiles according to preference.

CS179.6 & 179.15A Game Design Classes

FINAL OUTPUT: Game Pitch Document, Game Pitch Defense

Theoretical classes that explored the many facets of game design and development, and discussed the processes behind developing and releasing games.

CS179.14 PC and Console Game Development

FINAL OUTPUT: Asteroid-shooter game

Group project involving the use of C++ and SFML to develop a simple game

INTERACTIVE MEDIA

From the study of Human-Computer Interaction, to the development of interactive technologies themselves. My current personal strength is UI/UX for web, but I aim to continue building my Game Development experience.
